job_title: Volunteer Coordinator in Urbandale, IA
pros: They've done an excellent job of hiring the best. The team that they have built and the work life balance is unmatched in the at home services sector. Compassionate and knowledgeable leaders who hire the best and provide room for growth within your departments without micromanaging . High quality and high performing, while also being a thriving and laid back atmosphere. Management supports the team, so that the team can provide excellent care to our clients.
cons: Despite years of experience, new employees start out at the bottom with accrued vacation time.

job_title: Marketing Coordinator in Johnston, IA
pros: - People listen to feedback from all levels of the organization - Organization makes a real impact for so many people, I feel good about the work I do - The benefits package is better than anywhere else I've seen - There are many programs in place to support growth and continued education - Organization focuses on supporting healthy lifestyles for team members as well as clients and residents
cons: There are days I miss working remotely, but I didn't realize how much I had missed working in the office with a team until I started here.

job_title: Server/Waitress in Indianola, IA
pros: They offer the best benefits that I’ve even been offered. They require continued training which shows they really care about their residence. There is a positive, happy atmosphere in the community and staff.
cons: I can’t think of any at the moment. I was sad to leave, but was moving away. If I ever come back and need the work, I will try to get back on with the company.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Des Moines, IA
pros: Onboarding was seamless. Culture at WesleyLife is the real deal. Senior leadership truly cares about team members health and well being
cons: Being a not for profit and having a limited budget, at times it can feel like the team is a stretched a little thin

job_title: Sales Associate in Des Moines, IA
pros: They have a great nursing staff
cons: Leadership is bad. They don’t care about their employers

job_title: Caregiver, CNA in West Des Moines, IA
pros: Ok pay, free food, free parking.
cons: No LTD, chaotic environment, lots of cliques, software is a joke.

job_title: Housekeeper in Indianola, IA
pros: Compassionate nurses and therapists who cared about the residents. Caring and hardworking kitchen staff.
cons: Sassy and lazy CNA'S and lazy housekeepers. Some were disrespectful toward residents.

job_title: Staff Nurse in West Des Moines, IA
pros: Very accommodating to your scheduling needs. Promotes growth and learning opportunities within the company as well as supporting personal and professional growth outside the company. Great nursing management team. Honest, open, able to speak freely.
cons: A lot of work that can and should be done by the CNAs are actually pushed onto the nurse to complete, making time management for certain cares difficult. A couple nurses only have standard LTC knowledge and have let the other information slip away over time as well as a lack of desire to keep updated on ever changing standard protocols.

job_title: Lifestyles Coordinator in West Des Moines, IA
pros: Great place to work, friendly staff. Benefits are good, residents are kind, positive place to come to work.
cons: Pay is not too competitive. Food and Beverage department, RA and CNA turnover is somewhat high.

job_title: Executive Director in West Des Moines, IA
pros: WesleyLife is a terrific organization dedicated to a spirit of service to seniors and the community as a whole.  Executive Leaders allow a ton of freedom to lead communities with an entrepreneurial spirit and offers amazing support to the Executive Directors.  I feel incredibly grateful to be a part of an organization who is so dedicated to transforming the aging experience in older adults.  We are allowed to be creative and encouraged to facilitate ideas at the community level which will keep the organization and its residents progressively moving forward.
cons: The work is difficult and challenging.  The expectations are high and, at times, communication can be challenging around expectations, but these are generally consistent challenges and most organizations of our size and structure.  Additionally, we are an organization which is growing and taking on a lot.  At times, I feel we are struggling with the people power to handle it all, but we are scaling up and going through a lot of change at this time.  I feel we will overcome this hurdle.  Finally, I would say that the vision of where we want to go is not always communicated clearly.

job_title: Resident Assistant in Des Moines, IA
pros: Great friendly, accepting residents friends.
cons: Poor chaotic Management and Employees.

review_title: Residents are awesome, employee retention is awful, which leads to the environment being extremely stressful.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Des Moines, IA
pros:
First and foremost the residents. 
Helping them to make Wesley their home in whatever way possible, which gives one a sense of purpose.
cons:
Employee retention is awful. Especially management. In one location alone, the E.D. has changed at least 4 times within 5 years, the Administrator changed at least 6 times in 5 years, and the DON changed at least 8 times in 5 years. This led to some staff being retained even when they shouldn't have, only because the person in charge of those people didn't know the history of the problem staff members. 
Management fills in staffing gaps with agency people who really don't care to be there. I know numerous residents who were treated poorly by agency staff. 
Housekeeping, laundry, and CNA's are the employees who are treated the worst. But without them, the place wouldn't be able to run, literally. 
Management and upper management supposedly care about their employees, but actions speak louder than words. 
If you have the courage to report issues, a target is placed on your back. 
Most people just put their head down, pretend that they can't see what's going on, don't offer an opinion, do their job and go home. No pride taken in their work though.

review_title: Park centre Stay far far away
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Newton, IA
pros: The only good thing about working for wesley life is there benefits package that’s it.
cons: Your treated horribly from other staff members and management. The environment feels as if you are in a high school setting but with so called adults. Every other department try’s to turn you in for every little thing they over hear or see. It’s each department out for themselves there’s NO TEAM WORK!!!.  The residents were not cared for the way they should have been. And the most important part Don’t EVER bring your family member there to live find somewhere else or keep them at home and get in home care if you can afford it.  Everyone there like myself and a lot of others have recently quit do to these problems and others. They don’t have many staff members left that should tell them something. And the administration was a joke get your CNA licenses renewed and get your bottom back out on the floor and see what it was like for us to do the dirty work and see if you can get everyone up in the time you demand with the horrible equipment that was given to us and the 7 minute per resident rule who gets there own self ready in the morning in 7 minutes what a joke.

job_title: Administration in Des Moines, IA
pros: Our team members and our clients/residents are THE BEST.  I appreciate the opportunity to work with an exceptional group of people who are truly humble servants to those we serve. Our caregivers are incredible people who have an amazing ability to do the toughest work every day with a smile on their face. I'm honored to be a part of such a great group and am proud of our team members -- and I know the families who have trusted us to care for their loved ones feel the same. It's special to be on the team that believes in transforming the aging experience and is leading the way in the industry.
cons: Each team member has a responsibility to make healthy choices and keep life in balance. WesleyLife does a nice job of making the healthy choice the easy choice and encourages us to take care of ourselves...sometimes our team members don't do this and need to! Take care of yourself so you can take care of others and be your best.

job_title: Home Care Field Staff in Johnston, IA
pros: The patients and coworkers are great.
cons: They admit new patients daily but dont have the staff to cover them. You'll work 10 hour days Mon-Fri and weekends if you cant track down your people during the week. They work the field staff like dogs. Plan to drive to every side of town daily. And if you ever have a normal 8 hour-6 patient day dont expect it to look the same the next day. It changes daily. And even if you have 8 patients for the day you better have every piece of your paperwork done by midnight. Which means computer work every night for hours after working 9-10. I'm Looking for new job every day. They make it sound great and are always saying they are "hiring", "its going to get better soon" but it never does and all they care about is money here. For being such a "prestigious" company they dont run like one. People pay more for that but they won't get it. They are not at all professional or organized. I feel sorry for the patients, they never have enough home care aides to see them. This place cant keep staff because its so awful. Stay far away!!!!!!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Des Moines, IA
pros: Mission, front line employees at the communities  care about residents, financial strength.
cons: Job satisfaction at WesleyLife depends on where you work. Generally speaking, working at one of the communities can be a good experience, there are a couple that still have leadership problems, but overall the communities have good leaders that care about the employees.   However,   the corporate office is very toxic and it stems from the CEO.  The person has been in the role too long and has become entitled, micro manages, and is a poor “leader”.   Moreover, the person’s private, one-on-one persona  does match their public persona. The board is ultimately responsible for this as they do not recognize the problem and/or will not take action.  It’s  a shame given the mission of the organization and its Christian heritage.  It “could be” a fantastic place to work.

review_title: Do not recommend working here, very negative
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in West Des Moines, IA
pros: The residents, focus on health, some of the communities are nice.
cons: The company appears to be making attempts at changing the culture to improve morale and avoiding turnover, but when the bad apples are still given manager and leader roles, there is no incentive for them to change their behavior.  They may be great at their job, but they are terrible with people. That will never work. There are a lot of demands on nursing staff that never seem to end or improve. Things change so fast you never really feel there is a standard process. Give the employees a little slack and stop pushing so hard. Celebrate success and victories. The pressure put on employees is too much. I just don't enjoy working here with all the negativity.

review_title: Culture starts and ends at the top!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Johnston, IA
pros: Mission - never doubt the power of the mission of WesleyLife. The story is steadfast and true. There are many dedicated employees who keep their heads down and work tirelessly to support their teams and residents.
cons: The CEO needs to go. He has driven good people away, disparages them the minute they leave and replaces them with “yes men”. Anyone who speaks up or asks questions are quickly exited. When will the board recognize the turnover stems from his poor leadership. How many have left the corporate headquarters this year? Too many!

review_title: Be Inspired. Be Challenged. Be Healthy.
job_title: in Johnston, IA
pros: How can you not be inspired by a mission in which you are "Transforming the Aging Experience." Progressive and growing organization. Lots of great professionals. Top 150 Workplace and a Blue Zones Work Site.
cons: Iowa's growing aging population means WesleyLife is always striving to find more caring and compassionate team members to serve older adults living at WesleyLife's communities and in their homes. Everyone has a passion for what we do, we just need more hands to do it.

job_title: in Indianola, IA
pros: I am blessed to work with an amazing group of residents and team members. Our leaderhip team is very supportive. Our campus is beautiful and offers an onsite fitness center that is free to use along with classes for team members such as Zumba and Yoga, also free of charge. We get a free lunch once a week along with a steep discount at the E Street cafe on our campus. The Village is also a Blue Zones Designated workplace and there are many opportunites to engaged with our employee wellness programs throughout the year.
cons: Overall, I really enjoy working for WesleyLife.

job_title: Director of Nursing in West Des Moines, IA
pros: Overall positive environment a d currently.  Everyone feels sense of belong to this place. Employer do care about me as a person. Standards are set for ny to be successful at all times and I do enjoy what I do because  of the support system here.
cons: I can't think of any, I do enjoy my coworkers company and they do enjoy mine as well. This is by far one of the best place I have ever worked

review_title: Corporation going through changes, private duty outlook is bleak.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Des Moines, IA
pros: Wesley Retirement is a well managed caring environment with many long term employees.  Clients are well cared for and the facilities well maintained.
cons: Wesley Private duty is poorly managed and has high turn over of care providers and care coordinator staff.  The operation is poorly managed and the work environment is made hostile by management.

job_title: Director of Campus Well-Being in West Des Moines, IA
pros: WesleyLife not only beloved in taking care of the people we serve, but also the team members. There are efforts to create a positive culture that makes the healthy choice the easy choice. I feel blessed to work for an organization that values people as much as WesleyLife does.
cons: At times I feel like we need a clear, unified vision. It can feel like I am being pulled in multiple directions.

job_title: CNA in Des Moines, IA
pros: Great team members, great residents
cons: lack of  great employees!

review_title: A Discouraged Community in need of a Savior!

cons: Administration.  The females that run the building in Pella, Iowa turn their heads when ever a serious problem arises.  Getting the CEO or anyone in corporate office to help is like pulling teeth!

review_title: Sorry I ever walked in the door as an employee.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Des Moines, IA
pros: Nursing supervisory staff are excellent.  CNA's and RA's are great to work with and polite.  Nice benefit package.  After you have been here 5 years +, you get three weeks of vacation!
cons: We are needing more great people to fill open positions!

review_title: Best Place to Work in West Des Moines

cons: The Edgewater is location in West Des Moines  is a five-star, senior living community, close to Jordan Creek Mall.
